byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER SWANN and NEIL UNMACK

abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column; America's 'clean' natural gas is fetching four times its price in Asia, but prices would need to remain elevated for decades in order to justify massive infrastructure investments required to make exports possible; Euro zone leaders may be trying to tweak Greece's debt swap to impose marginally deeper losses on private creditors.
snippet: Surging global demand for natural gas may make the billions in infrastructure investments needed to export it make sense.

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

lead_paragraph: Surging global demand for natural gas may make the billions in infrastructure investments needed to export it make sense.

headline.main: Outlook Brightens for U.S. Gas Exports
headline.seo: Outlook Brightens for U.S. Gas Exports
